cab.content: !(Tfil^D-OCUKENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT). . S-E C R E T . WAR C A B I HE T.Gv T. 8157.IWITHDRAWAL OF BRITISH FORCES FROM NORTH RUSSIA^Copy of a letter from the Admiralty to to War Office0Admiralty, S.W. 1* 9 th September3. 1919.Sir,I am commanded by My Lords Commissioners of the admiralty to request that you will inform the Army Council that in view?"T!ar Cab-of the war Cabinet-decision that all British Forces shall linet 599Hinute 3. be withdrawn from North Russia as soon as possible, and that not even a British Mission shall remain at Murmansk, the Admiralty proposes to withdraw also all Naval Forces from the Arctic.2. The small craft evacuated from Archangel during September, 1919, will be collected at Murmansk, and pre-pared for the voyage to the United Kingdom, and it is essential that Murmansk should be occupied by the Military Forces until all these small craft have commenced their voy-age home.3. It is therefore proposed that the final withdrawal of the Naval Forces should coincide with the final- evacuation of the Military Forces from Murmansk.4. I am.to request that it may be stated at an early date whether the Army Council concur in these proposals, so that definite administrative arrangements can be made, and the Rear Admiral Commanding White Sea Station informed.' 5. A copy of-this letter has been sent to the Secretary, -tfar Cabinet., I am, Sir,Your obedient Servant,(Signed) W.F,Nicholson.The Secretary, tfar Office,
